intro: Cerastium meratii, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear cress, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Europe and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early summer, typically from June to July. Its leaves are rounded and hairy, adapted to withstand cold and arid conditions. Cerastium meratii thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine environments.
